samples.name: Default Functionalities
samples.description: The example demonstrates the default rendering of the Vue dialog, which supports modal and non-modal (modeless), built-in buttons, and more.

samples.name: Modal
samples.description: This example demonstrates the modal pop-up behavior of the Vue dialog component, which helps display critical information such as errors and warnings.

samples.name: Template
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to customize user interface elements like the header, footer, and content of the Vue dialog component using a template.

samples.name: Ajax Content
samples.description: The example demonstrates how to load the content of the Vue dialog component from external sources such as a file or website using Ajax library.

samples.name: Draggable
samples.description: This example shows how to enable drag-and-drop actions in the Vue dialog component to help reposition the dialog efficiently.

samples.name: Resizable
samples.description: This example shows how to create resizable modal in the Vue dialog to change the size of a dialog efficiently and view its content more comfortably.

samples.name: Positioning
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to display the Vue dialog component at various built-in and custom positions.

samples.name: Animation
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to open or close the Vue dialog with various animation effects, and how to customize the animation duration and delay.

samples.name: Multiple Dialogs
samples.description: This example shows how to display multiple dialogs sequentially and open multiple dialogs simultaneously for both modal and modeless Vue dialogs.

samples.name: Components inside Dialog
samples.description: This example demonstrates how to render other Vue Syncfusion components inside the dialog component.
